info.title: Area API
info.description:
### AREA provide action/reaction pairs on a web service, or a text representing an action of a web service, sent on another web service as a reaction.

# Introduction
This API is documented in **OpenAPI format** and is based on
[Petstore sample](http://petstore.swagger.io/) provided by [swagger.io](http://swagger.io) team.
It was **extended** to illustrate features of [generator-openapi-repo](https://github.com/Rebilly/generator-openapi-repo)
tool and [ReDoc](https://github.com/Redocly/redoc) documentation. In addition to standard
OpenAPI syntax we use a few [vendor extensions](https://github.com/Redocly/redoc/blob/master/docs/redoc-vendor-extensions.md).

# Authentication

AREA offers one form of authentication:
  - [Basic access authentication](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7617)
 is a method for an HTTP user agent (e.g. a web browser) to provide a user name and password when making a request. In basic HTTP authentication, a request contains a header field in the form of Authorization: Basic <credentials>, where credentials is the base64 encoding of id and password joined by a single colon :.

post.description: The server will decompose Authorization header to extract email and password. The password can come from a form or can be a Google login token.

409.description: This user already exists : email address conflict

403.description: Email or password does not match, or the account with this email does not exist

post.description: For each action, you can choose a specific reaction. Specific means that the reaction takes place on the same service as the action. For example, for the Youtube service, for the action "If your favorite youtuber releases a video", the specific reaction for this action can be "This video is added to the queue".

400.description: Invalid form : email formating or password length less than 6

403.description: Email or password does not match, or the account with this email does not exist

post.description: For each action, you can choose a generic reaction. Generic means that a text representing the action is sent on the service chosen as a reaction. For example, for the Youtube service, for the action "If your favorite youtubeur releases a video", the generic reaction to this action will be the sending of the text "Squeezie released a video today at 3 pm" on the service reaction you have chosen (an email on Office365 for example)
